  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING FOOD PRODUCTS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ILLINOIS USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER W2140A, GK FULFILLMENT CENTER, 199 SHEPARD AVE, WHEELING IL 60090-6021.

item.title: Report E-2024040222
item.description:
Report E-2024040222

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-12T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LSL experienced a UN3082 Zinc Sulfate Solution 33 - 36% release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to a 10’ x 30’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024040224
item.description:
Report E-2024040224

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-12T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: SIOUX FALLS
  • State: SD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XSO contacted ERTS regarding a punctured tote as a result of improper loading. The puncture resulted in a 12-ounce release of ScaleBreak onto the wooden trailer floor and the concrete dock floor. The trailer floor was impacted in a 4’x4’ area and the dock floor was impacted in an area of 4’x4’. A Contractor performed a tote transfer and cleaned-up the release. The damaged tote was cut-up and containerized for waste disposal along with the impacted oil dry, rags, and PPE. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAY experienced a UN2922 Nalcon 7634 release from 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 100-gallons of product released to 60' x 20' area of the concrete dock and a 40' x 15' area of the asphalt parking lot due to a forklift puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted area to clean the release. All impacted absorbents were containerized into (8) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with impacted absorbents and PPE into a cubic yard box. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

A Contractor cleaned up the release and repalletized the remaining, un-damaged product. Two drums of waste were generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.

  • Description: Captain notified to SOC in NRT at 11:42L by ACARS. Thermal containment bag was used for 8A customer's IPAD, which was stuck on rail of her seat and broken. Upon arrival at NRT, CS SPVR retrieved the bag and IPAD was crushed. The customer agreed for us to confiscate at NRT due to no way to repair. We learned that she was not aware of dropping her IPAD at her seat rail, when she was reclining her seat, then she heard the sound of a crack which caused by breaking IPAD. No fire, no smoke and no heat were produced, but for safety, FA used the thermal containment bag and placed at designated location during flight. Passenger Information:, Name: Carol Pulliam Address: 167 N. Cleveland Ave#400 Oceanside, CA 92054 Phone: 951-543-8608 Email: myrtle007@sbcglobal.net

item.title: Report I-2024040037
item.description:
Report I-2024040037

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-11T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UNLOAD SUPERVISOR CALLED THE LEAKING PACKAGE IN QUESTION OUT ON THE RESPONDER CHANNEL RESPONDER PROPERLY CONTAINED AND CLEANED UP THE SPILLED AREA BEFORE TRANSPORTING PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP ONCE AT THE DMR THE PACKAGE HAD NO OUTSIDE MARKINGS OR INDICATORS OF IT BEING A HAZARDOUS MATERIAL SO THE RESPONDER BEGAN PROCESS THE LEAKING PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE WAS NOT IN THE SYSTEM SO IT NEEDED TO BE GREEN BAGGED, DURING THE SOLIDIFICATION PROCESS, THE STRONG ODOR BECAME APPARENT. WHEN ASKED FOR INGREDIENTS, WE FOUND THE SDS OF THE PRODUCT(MARYKATE ON AND OFF HULL& BOTTOM CLEANER) IN QUESTION AND TURNED OUT TO BE A CLASS 8 CORROSIVE. WE IMMDIATELY STOPPED PROCESSING AND CALLED THE HAZMAT SUPPORT CENTER TO REPORT THE PACKAGE. PART VII- RECOMMENDATIONS/ACTIONS TAKEN TO PREVENT RECURRENCE

item.title: Report I-2024040043
item.description:
Report I-2024040043

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-11T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: LONDON
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: From employee witness: During a cabin walk-through, I noticed a strong chemical smell. I could see a flight attendant speaking with a passenger in the aisle of the B zone cabin. They were standing next to a Polaris seat with a flashlight. I immediately asked the flight attendant what was happening, and where the smell was coming from. He showed me a broken cell phone belonging to 12A Norris Dodson. From what I was told, Mr. Dodson woke sometime prior and realized his phone was no longer on his person. He notified flight attendant and asked for help in retrieving it. In the process of searching for the phone, flight attendant activated the electronic seat controls. The phone was crushed by the mechanism and the lithium battery was punctured. When I arrived at the seat, the phone was hot to the touch. There was no smoke, or any other indicator of fire. But to be safe, between the chemical smell and the heat of the phone, I decided to place the phone in the thermal containment bag. The pilots were notified, and the information was sent to Ground staff.

item.title: Report I-2024040050
item.description:
Report I-2024040050

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-11T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: Bridgeport
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MARTIN TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 20712
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver was traveling north bound on I-75 north of Flint, MI when he was pulled over by Michigan State Police at 16:15 ET for a lane restriction violation. Upon inspection of the tractor/trailer, the trooper detected a leak coming out from under the ss skin on the bottom of the trailer just in front of the rollover protection. A tub was placed underneath the leak to contain it until the cleanup crew from Michigan Spill Response arrived on scene. After a short period of time, the leak stopped and there was only residue on the trailer. At that time, the top of the trailer was visually inspected and right above the area of the leak, there was a 3" washout cap that had fresh residue in the area which indicated that it had leaked. When Michigan Spill Response arrived on scene, they went to the top of the trailer and determined that the front washout cap was loose. They removed the washout cap, inspected the gasket, and then secured the washout cap to the threaded connection. After replacing the cap, a surge test was conducted on site and the trailer showed no signs of of any further leakage. Michigan Spill Response cleaned the residue from the trailer and disposed of the product that was collected in the catch pan placed underneath the trailer. Once the residue was removed rom the trailer, the load continued on without further incident. L

  • Description: XPO-XTM contacted ERTS regarding a punctured leaking tote containing Predator MR2516. The tote was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 35-gallons of product onto the wooden trailer floor and concrete underneath the trailer. The trailer floor impact area was 18'x18' and the impact area underneath the trailer was 8'x20'. A Contractor performed a tote transfer, cut-up pallets that were impacted by the release, and cleaned-up the release on the trailer floor. Five drums of waste were generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by this incident.

  • Description: A pallet of Aldahol was shipped on a local service truck to Veolia's ten day intransit facility in Philadelphia, PA. Upon opening the service truck to offload the materials, the facility crew noted a pallet of items that had broken apart during transportation. Cardboard boxes were no longer secured to the pallet with some on their sides with obvious signs of leakage from the inner packages. An investigation revealed the stretch-wrap securing the boxes to the pallet failed during transportation due to heavy containers stacked on top of lighter weight containers. The pallet was not sufficiently wrapped to secure the boxes for transportation. Trained Veolia facility employees removed the stretch wrap and upright the packages. The leaking packages were overpacked and the material was repalletized appropriately. The stretch wrap was wrapped to the pallet of containers utilizing a mechanical means to ensure proper stretch wrap tension and securement to the pallet.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 03/20/2024, during cruise phase of flight DL182 (JFK-FCO), a passenger identified a vape pen in a lavatory trash bin that was smoking. The flight attendant retrieved the vape pen from the trash bin and noted that the device was still smoking/"hissing". The flight attendant met with the captain, and they elected to remove the battery and place the vape pen into a containment bag. The captain then returned to the flight deck and contacted dispatch. A decision was made to continue to FCO as the vape pen had stopped smoking. No Flight Attendant or customer injuries were reported. The NRC and FAA were notified.

item.title: Report X-2024040105
item.description:
Report X-2024040105

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-08T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: NORTHBROOK
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED WITH FULL PPE AND RESPONSE CART TO SOUTH PRIMARY SORT AISLE TO PICK UP REPORTED LEAKING PACKAGE. RECTANGULAR PACKAGE IS INTACT, DISCOLORED AND SLIGHTLY SOFT ON ONE END. NO SPILLAGE TO CLEAN UP. PUT THE PACKAGE IN LINED SPILL TOTE AND PROMPTLY RETURNED IT TO THE PSC CAGE. UPON OPENING THE PACKAGE FOUND LARGE 3" DIAMETER TABLETS LINING TWO SIDES OF THE BOX AND A PLASTIC BIN INSIDE. THE PLASTIC BIN HAS AN OXIDIZER 5.1 YELLOW DIAMOND LABEL PRINTED ON ONE SIDE. THE LID SEAL ON THE BIN IS INTACT AND SEALED. THE LOOSE TABLETS AND SOME SMALL WADS OF NEWSPAPER LINE 2 SIDES OF THE BOX. THERE ARE NO LABELS ON THE USED OUTER CARTON, EXCEPT A PIECE OF PAPER TAPED ON BEARING THE NUMBERS 525D-619-010. CALLED THE HAZMAT HELP DESK AND SUBMITTED AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT REPORT. THIS PACKAGE WILL BE ENTERED INTO ETT AND HELD FOR INSPECTION.

  • Description: 4 drums were received on a Bill of Lading. The material was supposed to be paint solids and non-hazardous. Our lab determined that the material was liquid and was paint. The material had a flash point of <140 degrees. The material should've shipped as a hazardous waste ( waste codes D001). Our lab put the shipment on hold. It was determined this was an undeclared waste shipment. A hazardous waste manifest was created for the batch and sent to the customer for signature. The drums were relabeled as hazardous waste and will be handled as such. Customer was notified of all steps to resolve the waste shipment discrepancy

The caller stated that (1) a five-liter jerrycan that was punctured by a nail in it's pallet impacting the trailer. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal who felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE. (1) 10-gallon metal drum containing the impacted "Oil Dri" absorbent material, the damaged jerrycan, the remaining material, and issued PPE was containerized as waste and it was left onsite for the terminal to manage.
